Module com.example.fiftyclash
Package com.example.fiftyclash.models

Class Player

java.lang.Object
com.example.fiftyclash.models.Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
HumanPlayer, Machine
public abstract class Player extends Object
Abstract class representing a player in the game. A player has a hand of cards and the ability to draw and play cards.

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player()
      Constructor for the Player class. Initializes the player's hand with 4 cards.

  • Method Details

    • getHandCards

      public Card[] getHandCards()
      Gets the player's current hand of cards.
      Returns:
      An array of Card objects representing the player's hand.

    • drawCard

      public void drawCard(Deck drawDeck)
      Draws a card from the provided draw deck and adds it to the player's hand. It will fill any empty slots in the hand.
      Parameters:
      drawDeck - The deck from which cards are drawn.

    • playCard

      public void playCard(int index, Deck playDeck, Deck drawDeck)
      Plays a card from the player's hand by moving it to the play deck and drawing a new card from the draw deck to replace it.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the card to be played in the player's hand.
      playDeck - The deck where the played card is added.
      drawDeck - The deck from which a new card is drawn to replace the played card.

    • printHandCards

      public void printHandCards()
      Prints the cards in the player's hand to the console. Displays the value and icon of each card in the hand.

    • selectPlayCard

      public int selectPlayCard(int currentPoints)
      Selects a card to play based on the current points. This method is overridden by specific player types.
      Parameters:
      currentPoints - The current points value used to determine the best card to play.
      Returns:
      The index of the selected card to play, or 0 by default.

    • setCanPlay

      public void setCanPlay(boolean canPlay)
      Sets whether the player is allowed to play.
      Parameters:
      canPlay - A boolean indicating whether the player can play.

    • getCanPlay

      public boolean getCanPlay()
      Gets whether the player is allowed to play.
      Returns:
      A boolean indicating whether the player can play.
